Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LFampin 259–284 (Predicted AMPs, bovine lactoferrin bLF N1 domain residues 259-284, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: identified based on in silico analysis of protease digestion sites.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is 65.38% similar toLFampin 268–284. K: 23%, L=S: 12%.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli K12 (LC50 11.7 uM), and yeast C. albicans ATCC 10231 (LC50 2.3 uM). Warning:  other bacteria not tested.
Literature Information.Author: Bolscher JG, van der Kraan MI, Nazmi K, Kalay H, Grün CH, Van't Hof W, Veerman EC, Nieuw Amerongen AV.2006
Literature Information.Title: A one-enzyme strategy to release an antimicrobial peptide from the LFampin-domain of bovine lactoferrin.
